message.content:
cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.SY, cs.DC, cs.AR. 

The paper discusses the problem of assumptions in software design and proposes strategies to address it. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, but the most likely one is software engineering (cs.SE) since the paper focuses on software design and architecture. Programming languages (cs.PL) is also a possible category since the paper discusses how assumptions are expressed and verified in code. Systems and control (cs.SY) is another possible category since the paper deals with the interaction between software and its deployment platforms and run-time environments. Distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) is a possible category since the paper discusses the complexity of software systems and the need to decompose them. Finally, computer architecture (cs.AR) is a possible category since the paper proposes a new holistic approach to software development.
